intro: Mariscus beecheyi, commonly known as the Beekley's mariscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive reddish hue when mature. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
